overview.name: Luxottica Tristar Optical Co.
overview.description: This is the factory where the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses are manufactured before being handed to freight handler DHL.

location.address: Oudeng zone, Gaobu town, Dongguan city, Guangdong, China

overview.name: DHL Global Forwarding (China) Co.
overview.description: This is the DHL facility in Dongguan, China where the product is forwarded to the next point.

location.address: OFR Station No.200 Hongfu Road, Nancheng District , 20F/2, Head Plaza B DongGuan, 523000 GD

overview.name: DHL Sort Facity Shenzhen
overview.description: This is where the product is sorted and forwarded to the next point in Hong Kong.

location.address: AFR Station,OFR Station NO.12 Shihua Road, , Floor 2, PHILIPS Research and Development Building, , Futian Free Trade Zone Shenzhen, 518038

overview.name: DHL Air Hub Hong Kong
overview.description: This is where the product is sorted and forwarded to mthe next point in the US.

location.address: 17/F, China Aerospace Centre, 143 Hoi Bun Rd, Kwun Tong, Hong Kong

overview.name: DHL Cincinnati Hub
overview.description: This is location handles the customs clearance processes and is the first US hub before it is shipped to the buyer's state (NY).

location.address: 236 Wendell H Ford Blvd, Erlanger, KY 41018

overview.name: DHL New York City Gateway
overview.description: This is DHL's gateway point in New York City. Because I ordered the product to be delivered directly to me, the parcel arrived here before arriving at another NYC facility, and then was shipped to my home address.

location.address: Jfk Int'L Airport, S Cargo Rd Bldg 263, Queens, NY 11430

overview.name: Luxottica Distribution Center
overview.description: For in-store retail products, countries where Luxottica brands (Ray-Ban) are manufactured (Italy & China) ship the products to Luxottica's main Distribution Center in Atlanta. This center then distributes their products to regional centers for retail stores. The distribution center also is responsible for processing returns. A bulk of the designing and manufacturing processes are also done in this Atlanta facility.

location.address: 100 Greenwood Industrial Pkwy. McDonough GA 30253

overview.name: Ray-Ban NYC Flagship Store
overview.description: This is Ray-Ban's first flagship store in New York City where their products can be purchased by consumers. The Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses' final destination before going to the buyer.

location.address: 116 Wooster St, New York, NY 10012

overview.name: Qualcomm China Corporate Office
overview.description: Qualcomm is the company responsible for the technical aspects of the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses. They deliver the product's operating platform, Snapdragon AR1 Gen 1. This location is where the cameras are developed

location.address: No.38 Gaoxin 6 Rd, Xi'an, Shaanxi, 710075, China

overview.description: The Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses frame is made from cellulose acetate propionate injected into a mould. The material is a plastic derived from wood pulp. The information I was able to obtain is that Luxottica sources their wood pulp from the Dolomites, a mountain range in Italy. However, this information seems only applicable to Ray-Ban products made in Italy. Since the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses are manufactured in China and China is a top country for wood pulp production, I will make an educated guess that Luxottica sources the wood pulp for their China-manufactured products in China.

location.address: China

overview.description: The Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses lenses are made of glass, a secondary material made from silica sand. Existing sources for other Ray-Ban products state they source their silica sand from Europe. However, I will make an educated guess that Luxottica sources silica sand from China, considering China accounts for approximately 68% global silica mining and production.

location.address: China

overview.name: Meta Headquarters
overview.description: Meta is the company that developed Llama 2, the open-source large language model that powers the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses. They also developed the Meta View app, the mobile application that controls the smart glasses and stores media taken from the glasses, and Meta AI, the smart glasses' conversational AI.

location.address: 1 Hacker Wy, Menlo Park, CA 94025

overview.name: Qualcomm Headquarters
overview.description: Qualcomm is the company that developed Snapdragon AR1 Gen1, the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses' operating platform.

location.address: 6455 Lusk Blvd, San Diego, CA 92121

overview.name: Monocrystal
overview.description: The material used to make the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses' camera lenses and LED light covers are most likely sapphire crystal. Sapphire crystal is an extremely durable and scratch-proof material that is widely utilized, especially in the tech industry, such as to make watch faces, camera lenses, and LED light covers. Monocrystal is recognized as the largest sapphire manufacturer. It is headquartered in Russia and has 3 fabs in Russia and China. Monocrystal was also responsible for supplying Apple's Apple Watch screens. I am making the assumption that Monocrystal produces the sapphire crystal that makes up the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses' camera lenses and LED light covers. I am also assuming that the factory that supplies the Luxottica factory is Monocrystal's China factory.

location.address: No.97, Liuyanghe Rd., Trina PV Park, New District, 21303 Changzhou, Jiangsu, China

overview.name: Aluminum Corporation of China Limited
overview.description: Sapphire crystal is made from the crystallisation of pure Aluminum Oxide at high temperatures. Aluminium Oxide is chemically produced from Bauxite. Most of the world's Bauxite is mined in Australia, Guinea, and China. I will assume that Monocrystal sources their Aluminium Oxide from China, considering their factories are in China and Russia. China's largest Bauxite miner and Aluminum producer is the Aluminum Corporation of China Limited (ACCL). The company also extracts Aluminum Oxide from their mined Bauxite. They have multiple mines all across China but for this project, I will input the location as ACCL's largest mine.

location.address: 8GJ9+8VQ, Xiaguang Blvd, Pingguo, Baise, Guangxi, China, 531405

overview.name: GlobalFoundries
overview.description: Powering the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses is Qualcomm's Snapdragon AR1 Gen1 processing system. Qualcomm's chips are produced by GlobalFoundries, particularly in their New York fab.

location.address: 400 Stone Break Rd Extension, Malta, NY 12020

overview.description: Ray-Ban's cleaning cloths are made from specially-treated microfiber. The majority of the world's microfiber manufacturers are in China. Thus, I will assume that Ray-Ban sources their microfiber cloths from China. Because there are so many different large factories in China, I do not have enough information to make an educated guess on which specific manufacturer supplies Ray-Ban.

location.address: China

overview.name: Great Power Battery
overview.description: The battery that supports the interior of the smart glasses is a 0.595WH Li-Po battery. Lithium Polymer batteries are lighter and smaller, hence their use as the battery that supports the smart glasses. The majority of Lithium Polymer manufacturers are in China. Luxottica's main manufacturing facility that is responsible for these smart glasses is also in China. Hence, I will assume the specific battery used in Ray-Ban Meta's smart glasses are sourced from China. Great Power Battery is a world-class lithium (Li-Po and Li-Ion) manufacturer based in China and I will assume that Ray-Ban sources their Li-Po battery from Great Power.

location.address: No. 912 Shiliang Road, Shawan town, Panyu, Guangzhou, China

overview.name: Great Power Battery
overview.description: The battery within the glasses' charging case is a 154 MAH Li-Ion pouch. I will assume that this battery is also manufactured in China and at Great Power Battery.

location.address: No. 912 Shiliang Road, Shawan town, Panyu, Guangzhou, China

overview.name: Amionx
overview.description: Qualcomm recently made a big investment in Amionx, a technology invention company that is a leader in safe battery technology. Amionx developed and patented a technology called SafeCoreO that prevents lithium ion batteries from being the source of fire or explosion. Because Li-Ion batteries are used in the smart glasses' charging case and Qualcomm is a major partner of this product, I will assume that Amionx's technology is utilized.

location.address: 2261 Rutherford Rd, Carlsbad, CA 92008

overview.name: Great Power Battery
overview.description: China is one of the top countries for Lithium mining and production. Thus, I will assume the Chinese companies manufacturing Li-Po and Li-Ion batteries for the production of the smart glasses source their Lithium from China.

location.address: No. 912 Shiliang Road, Shawan town, Panyu, Guangzhou, China

overview.name: BIWIN
overview.description: The memory card used on the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses is listed on their website as 32GB EMMC. The product tear-down video shows that the memory card embedded in the glasses are from BIWIN Technology. The company manufactures its products at its latest facility, BIWIN Huizhou Science and Technology Zone.

location.address: Huizhou, China

overview.name: TampoPrint
overview.description: The approval markings on the frame of the glasses are done using TampoPrint. TampoPrint is a German company that develops pad printing and laser systems for industrial product marking and labeling. I assume Luxottica owns TampoPrint machines in their factories to do the approval markings on their glasses. The location I will input is TampoPrint's subsidiary in the USA.

location.address: 1400 26th St, Vero Beach, FL 32960
